intro: Echites mucronatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the genus Echites.
